title: Research: Chrome extension conversion
description: Research what it takes to convert Brute Bookmarks to a Chrome extension, Chrome Web Store procedures, data persistence options without backend, and LLM integration for autofill/import parsing
close_reason: Research complete - documented Chrome extension architecture, Web Store publishing, storage options, and LLM integration strategies

title: Migrate user preferences to Convex
description: Store theme, accent color, card size, page width, show card names in Convex userPreferences table. On save: write to both localStorage (instant) and Convex (persistent/sync). On load: read localStorage first (already done via head script), then hydrate from Convex if newer. This completes Strategy 4.

title: Build Chrome extension: new tab override
description: Create a Manifest V3 Chrome extension that overrides the new tab page with the Brute Bookmarks web app. The extension loads the hosted URL in an iframe or directly embeds the built frontend. User configures their account URL in extension options. Minimal extension code — the app itself is the hosted Convex-backed web app.

title: Replace Express server with Convex-only architecture
description: Remove server.js, middleware/, and Express dependencies. The frontend becomes a static site served from any CDN/hosting (Vercel, Netlify, or even GitHub Pages). All API logic lives in Convex functions. Update Docker setup or replace with static deployment config. Update package.json scripts.

title: Build Chrome extension: context menu quick-add
description: Add a right-click context menu item 'Add to Brute Bookmarks' that captures the current page URL and title, opens a small popup to pick a category, and saves the bookmark via Convex mutation. Requires the user to be authenticated (Clerk token stored in extension). This is the killer feature that justifies the extension over a plain bookmark.

title: Migrate icon pipeline to Convex actions + file storage
description: Move icon fetching (Wikimedia, DuckDuckGo favicon, Twemoji) and processing (Sharp resize/convert) into Convex actions (Node.js runtime). Store processed icons in Convex file storage instead of /icons/ directory. Update frontend to use Convex file URLs. This replaces /api/search-icons, /api/download-icon, /api/upload-icon, /api/get-favicon, /api/search-emojis, /api/download-emoji endpoints.

title: Chrome Web Store submission
description: Prepare Chrome Web Store assets: 128x128 icon, screenshots (1280x800), privacy policy, store description. Submit for review. $5 one-time fee. Review takes 1-3 days.

title: Initialize Convex project and schema
description: Set up Convex in the project: npx convex init, define the schema (categories table with bookmarks array, userPreferences table for theme/accent/cardSize/pageWidth/showCardNames, icons table or file storage). Configure Convex with Clerk auth provider.

title: Epic: Convex backend + Chrome extension hybrid
description: Migrate Brute Bookmarks from Express/file-based backend to Convex for real-time sync, cross-device support, and managed infrastructure. Build a companion Chrome extension (new tab override + context menu). Clerk auth stays (native Convex integration). localStorage remains as instant-load cache (Strategy 4).

title: Category tab grouping: dock categories into shared tabbed containers
description: Categories display vertically by default (current behavior). Users can group categories into tabbed containers where they share space and switch via tabs — like browser tabs or editor panes. Requires a groupId field on categories (or separate grouping table) in Convex schema. Includes drag-to-group and drag-to-ungroup interactions. Do after Convex CRUD migration (depends on zml).

title: Fix Wikimedia icon search/download pipeline
description: Something broken in the Wikimedia Commons icon search or download flow. Investigate server.js endpoints: /api/search-icons and /api/download-icon. Pre-migration fix — Express-only.

title: Write comprehensive documentation
close_reason: Updated README.md with Clerk auth, Docker deployment, complete API docs, emoji icons, and fixed file structure

title: Migrate bookmark CRUD to Convex mutations/queries
description: Replace /api/data GET/POST with Convex queries and mutations. Categories and bookmarks read/write through Convex instead of bookmarks.json. Keep localStorage as write-through cache for instant load (Strategy 4). Use Convex reactive queries so changes sync in real-time across tabs/devices.
